docs.title: Arithmetic Formatter Documentation
docs.text: Welcome to the official documentation for Arithmetic Formatter, a Python package and command-line tool for arranging arithmetic problems in clean, readable vertical format.

docs.title: 🚀 Features
docs.text:
• Align arithmetic problems vertically
  • Validate operators and numbers
  • Clean, consistent formatting
  • Optional answer display
  • CLI and Python API
  • Extensible package structure

docs.title: API Reference
docs.text: This section documents the core functions provided by the package.

docs.title: Parameters
docs.text:
• problems: list of strings Each item must follow "number operator number" format.

  • show_answers: bool Whether to include the computed answers.

docs.title: Usage Guide
docs.text: This guide explains how to use Arithmetic Formatter via the Python API and the CLI.

docs.title: 🧪 Python API
docs.text:
```python from arithmetic_formatter import arithmetic_arranger

result = arithmetic_arranger(["32 + 698", "1 - 2"], show_answers=True) print(result)
